rules.natural: If a journal publishes findings, then that journal is peer-reviewed.
Under the condition that a conference features an exhibition, media covers that conference.
A conference features an exhibition or a conference features a demonstration.

If a conference highlights a demonstration, then, under the condition that the conference features a demonstration, it follows that if the conference schedules an event, it does not cancel that event.
If a committee approves a venue, then that committee organizes a conference.
A committee approves a venue or a committee selects a venue.
If a venue books a conference, then a researcher does not attend a conference.
Provided that a venue reserves a conference, that venue books a conference.
Either a committee rejects a venue, or, if a committee selects a venue, then that venue reserves a conference.
If a researcher accepts an invitation, then a speaker invited that researcher.
Provided that a researcher declines an invitation, that researcher does not attend a conference.
A researcher chairs a session, or, if a journal does not publish findings, then a researcher does not participate in a panel.
If media reports findings, then either media covers a conference or, whenever a conference schedules an event, it does not cancel that event.
Under the condition that media broadcasts findings, media reports findings.
If a researcher presents a keynote, then that researcher does not attend a conference.
A researcher presents a keynote or a researcher presents a workshop.
Provided that a demonstration displays a phenomenon, then, if a conference schedules an event, it does not cancel that event.
If a demonstration operates correctly, then it is not the case that the demonstration malfunctions equipment.
Whenever a technician tests equipment, a demonstration operates correctly.
A technician tests equipment or a technician calibrates equipment.
Provided that a technician calibrates equipment, a demonstration operates correctly.
If a researcher travels to a region, then a grant funds that researcher.
Either a conference cancels an event or a grant does not fund a researcher.
Provided that a conference postpones an event, that conference does not cancel that event.
A conference postpones an event or a conference schedules an event.
If it is not the case that, if a conference features a demonstration, then that demonstration displays a phenomenon, then the demonstration malfunctions equipment.
If it is not the case that a researcher accepts an invitation or a researcher declines an invitation, then it is not the case that a speaker regrets that researcher.
Under the condition that it is not the case that, if a researcher presents a workshop, then that researcher does not attend a conference, that researcher submits an abstract.
Provided that it is not the case that, if a researcher presents a workshop, then that researcher does not attend a conference, it is not the case that that researcher submits an abstract.

rules.prover9_expression: (-(-(accepts(researcher, invitation) | declines(researcher, invitation)) -> regrets(speaker, researcher)) -> insists(speaker, researcher))
rules.natural: If it is not the case that, if it is not the case that a researcher accepts an invitation or a researcher declines an invitation, then a speaker regrets that researcher, then a speaker insists on that researcher.
Provided that a journal does not publish findings, a researcher attends a conference.
If a journal does not publish findings, then a researcher participates in a panel.
Whenever a journal is not peer-reviewed, a researcher travels to a region.

A committee does not reject a venue.
A speaker does not invite a researcher.

A researcher does not chair a session.

(A1 → G).natural: If a journal publishes findings, then that journal is peer-reviewed.

(A10 → ¬A8).natural: Provided that a conference schedules an event, the conference does not cancel that event.

(A11 ∨ (A10 → ¬A8)).natural: Either media covers a conference, or, if a conference schedules an event, then that conference does not cancel that event.

(A12 → A11).natural: Under the condition that a conference features an exhibition, media covers that conference.

(A12 ∨ A13).natural: A conference features an exhibition or a conference features a demonstration.

(A13 → (A10 → ¬A8)).natural: Whenever a conference features a demonstration, then, provided that the conference schedules an event, it does not cancel that event.

(A13 → A30).natural: Provided that a conference features a demonstration, that demonstration displays a phenomenon.

(A14 → (A13 → (A10 → ¬A8))).natural: If a conference highlights a demonstration, then, under the condition that the conference features a demonstration, it follows that if the conference schedules an event, it does not cancel that event.

(A15 ∨ ¬A2).natural: Either a committee organizes a conference, or it is not the case that a researcher attends a conference.

(A16 → A15).natural: If a committee approves a venue, then that committee organizes a conference.

(A16 ∨ A17).natural: A committee approves a venue or a committee selects a venue.

(A17 → A18).natural: Provided that a committee selects a venue, that venue books a conference.

(A17 → A19).natural: Whenever a committee selects a venue, that venue reserves a conference.

(A17 → ¬A2).natural: Under the condition that a committee selects a venue, a researcher does not attend a conference.

(A18 → ¬A2).natural: If a venue books a conference, then a researcher does not attend a conference.

(A19 → A18).natural: Provided that a venue reserves a conference, that venue books a conference.

(A20 ∨ (A17 → A19)).natural: Either a committee rejects a venue, or, if a committee selects a venue, then that venue reserves a conference.

(A21 ∨ ¬A2).natural: A speaker invites a researcher or it is not the case that a researcher attends a conference.

(A22 → A21).natural: If a researcher accepts an invitation, then a speaker invited that researcher.

(A22 ∨ A23).natural: Either a researcher accepts an invitation or a researcher declines an invitation.

(A23 → ¬A2).natural: Provided that a researcher declines an invitation, that researcher does not attend a conference.

(A27 ∨ (¬A1 → ¬A26)).natural: A researcher chairs a session, or, if a journal does not publish findings, then a researcher does not participate in a panel.

(A28 → (A11 ∨ (A10 → ¬A8))).natural: If media reports findings, then either media covers a conference or, whenever a conference schedules an event, it does not cancel that event.

(A29 → A28).natural: Under the condition that media broadcasts findings, media reports findings.

(A3 → ¬A2).natural: If a researcher presents a keynote, then that researcher does not attend a conference.

(A3 ∨ A4).natural: A researcher presents a keynote or a researcher presents a workshop.

(A30 → (A10 → ¬A8)).natural: Provided that a demonstration displays a phenomenon, then, if a conference schedules an event, it does not cancel that event.

(A32 → ¬A31).natural: If a demonstration operates correctly, then it is not the case that the demonstration malfunctions equipment.

(A33 → A32).natural: Whenever a technician tests equipment, a demonstration operates correctly.

(A33 ∨ A34).natural: A technician tests equipment or a technician calibrates equipment.

(A34 → A32).natural: Provided that a technician calibrates equipment, a demonstration operates correctly.

(A4 → ¬A2).natural: Under the condition that a researcher presents a workshop, that researcher does not attend a conference.

(A6 → A7).natural: If a researcher travels to a region, then a grant funds that researcher.

(A8 ∨ ¬A7).natural: Either a conference cancels an event or a grant does not fund a researcher.

(A9 → ¬A8).natural: Provided that a conference postpones an event, that conference does not cancel that event.

(A9 ∨ A10).natural: A conference postpones an event or a conference schedules an event.

(¬(A13 → A30) → A31).natural: If it is not the case that, if a conference features a demonstration, then that demonstration displays a phenomenon, then the demonstration malfunctions equipment.

(¬(A22 ∨ A23) → A24).natural: Whenever it is not the case that either a researcher accepts an invitation or a researcher declines an invitation, then a speaker regrets that researcher.

(¬(A22 ∨ A23) → ¬A24).natural: If it is not the case that a researcher accepts an invitation or a researcher declines an invitation, then it is not the case that a speaker regrets that researcher.

(¬(A4 → ¬A2) → A5).natural: Under the condition that it is not the case that, if a researcher presents a workshop, then that researcher does not attend a conference, that researcher submits an abstract.

(¬(A4 → ¬A2) → ¬A5).natural: Provided that it is not the case that, if a researcher presents a workshop, then that researcher does not attend a conference, it is not the case that that researcher submits an abstract.

(¬(¬(A22 ∨ A23) → A24) → A25).prover9_expression: (-(-(accepts(researcher, invitation) | declines(researcher, invitation)) -> regrets(speaker, researcher)) -> insists(speaker, researcher))
(¬(¬(A22 ∨ A23) → A24) → A25).natural: If it is not the case that, if it is not the case that a researcher accepts an invitation or a researcher declines an invitation, then a speaker regrets that researcher, then a speaker insists on that researcher.

(¬A1 → A2).natural: Provided that a journal does not publish findings, a researcher attends a conference.

(¬A1 → A26).natural: If a journal does not publish findings, then a researcher participates in a panel.

(¬A1 → ¬A26).natural: Under the condition that a journal does not publish findings, a researcher does not participate in a panel.

(¬G → A6).natural: Whenever a journal is not peer-reviewed, a researcher travels to a region.

¬A11.natural: It is not the case that media covers a conference.

¬A15.natural: It is not the case that a committee organizes a conference.

¬A2.natural: A researcher does not attend a conference.

¬A20.natural: A committee does not reject a venue.

¬A8.natural: A conference does not cancel an event.
